Swarm.name: Swarm
Swarm.description: • Swarm: +2 to recover from being @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03damageeffect00]{Shaken}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01characters0000]{Parry} +2. Swarms are composed of many small creatures, so cutting and piercing weapons do no real damage. @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03areaeffectat00]{Area eﬀect attacks} work normally, and a character can stomp to inﬂict his damage in @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Strength} each round. Some swarms (bees, hornets, birds) may be foiled by total immersion in water.

Hardy.name: Hardy
Hardy.description: • @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor06bestia.JournalEntryPage.06specialabili14]{Hardy}: The creature does not suffer a Wound from being @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Damage Effects]{Shaken} twice.

Construct.name: Construct
Construct.description: • @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor06bestia.JournalEntryPage.06specialabili05]{Construct}: +2 to recover from being @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03damageeffect00]{Shaken}; ignores 1 point of Wound penalties; does not breathe or suffer from @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04disease0000000]{disease} or @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04poison00000000]{poison}.

Slow Regeneration.name: Slow Regeneration
Slow Regeneration.description: • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Special Ability (Regeneration)]{Slow Regeneration}: The creature makes a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03healing0000000#natural-healing]{natural healing roll} once per day.

Burrow.name: Burrow
Burrow.description: • @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor06bestia.JournalEntryPage.06specialabili03]{Burrow} (20″): Giant worms tunnel through the ground, blocked only by solid bedrock.

Change Form.name: Change Form
Change Form.description: • Change Form: As an action, a vampire can change into a wolf or bat with a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Smarts} roll at −2. Changing back into humanoid form requires a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Smarts} roll.

Fear.name: Fear
Fear.description: • @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor06bestia.JournalEntryPage.06specialabili10]{Fear}: Anyone who sees this terror must make a Fear check.

Poison.name: Poison
Poison.description: • @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor06bestia.JournalEntryPage.06specialabili22]{Poison}: The GM chooses what kind of @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04poison00000000]{poison} the viper injects.

Charm.name: Charm
Charm.description: • Charm: Vampires can use the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Puppet]{puppet} power on those attracted to them (GM’s call) using their @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Smarts} as their @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr00]{arcane skill}. They can cast and maintain the power indefinitely, but may only affect one target at a time.

Elemental.name: Elemental
Elemental.description: • @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor06bestia.JournalEntryPage.06specialabili06]{Elemental}: No additional damage from @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Called Shots]{Called Shots}, ignores 1 point of Wound penalties, doesn’t breathe, immune to @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04disease0000000]{disease} and @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04poison00000000]{poison}.

Infravision.name: Infravision
Infravision.description: • @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor06bestia.JournalEntryPage.06specialabili18]{Infravision} Halve penalties for Illumination when attacking warm targets.

Undead.name: Undead
Undead.description: • @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor06bestia.JournalEntryPage.06specialabili29]{Undead}: +2 Toughness; +2 to recover from being @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Damage Effects]{Shaken}; no additional damage from @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Called Shots]{Called Shots}; ignores 1 point of Wound penalties; doesn’t breathe; immune to @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04disease0000000]{disease} and @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04poison00000000]{poison}.

Fear (-2).name: Fear (-2)
Fear (-2).description: • @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor06bestia.JournalEntryPage.06specialabili10]{Fear} (−2): Anyone who sees this horror must make a Fear check at −2.

Infection.name: Infection
Infection.description: • Infection: Anyone slain by a were­wolf has a 50% chance of rising as a werewolf themselves. The character involuntarily transforms every full moon. He gains control of his lycanthropy only after [[/sr 1d6 # Years after which the character gains control of lycanthropy]] years as a werewolf.

Fearless.name: Fearless
Fearless.description: • @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor06bestia.JournalEntryPage.06specialabili11]{Fearless}: Immune to @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04fear0000000000]{Fear} and @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Intimidation]{Intimidation}, but may be smart enough to react to fear-causing situations aptly.

Seep.name: Seep
Seep.description: • Seep: Can squeeze through any porous gap as if it were @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03movement000000]{Difficult Ground}.

Zombie.name: Zombie
Zombie.description: • Zombie: Liches are necromancers first and foremost. The undead they raise through the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Zombie]{zombie} spell are permanent, and they may raise @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-bestiary.Skeleton]{skeletons} just like @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-bestiary.Zombie]{zombies} as they choose. Some liches have built up entire armies of the undead at their disposal.

Low Light Vision.name: Low Light Vision
Low Light Vision.description: • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Special Ability (Low Light Vision)]{Low Light Vision}: Ignore penalties for Dim and Dark @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03illumination00]{Illumination}.

Wall Walker.name: Wall Walker
Wall Walker.description: • @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor06bestia.JournalEntryPage.06specialabili30]{Wall Walker}:The creatures move at their full @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03movement000000]{Pace} on walls and ceilings! Creepy!

Resilient.name: Resilient
Resilient.description: • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Special Ability (Resilient or Very Resilient)]{Resilient}: Some creatures can take one Wound before they’re Incapacitated.

Sire.name: Sire
Sire.description: • Sire: Anyone slain by a vampire has a 50% chance of rising as a vampire in [[/r 1d4]] days.

Ethereal.name: Ethereal
Ethereal.description: • @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor06bestia.JournalEntryPage.06specialabili09]{Ethereal}: Ghosts can become invisible and immaterial at will and can only be harmed by magical attacks.

Constrict.name: Constrict
Constrict.description: • Constrict: +2 to @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Athletics} and @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Strength} rolls made to @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03grappling00000]{grapple}.

Swat.name: Swat
Swat.description: • @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor06bestia.JournalEntryPage.06specialabili27]{Swat}: Dragons ignore up to 4 points of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Size and Scale]{Scale} penalties when attacking with their claws.

Tentacles.name: Tentacles
Tentacles.description:
The creature has a number of “tentacle actions” specified in its description (usually 2 or 4). Tentacle actions collectively count as one of a creature’s three potential actions for the turn. The actions must stem from the tentacle in some way—usually a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Fighting]{Fighting}, @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Shooting]{Shooting}, or @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03grappling00000]{grappling} attack, but this is the GM’s call.

If the creature is a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03wildcardsand00]{Wild Card}, it rolls its @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03traitrolls0000]{Wild Die} with each tentacle action as usual.

If the being performs other actions on its turn, such as @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Taunt]{Taunting} or casting a spell, these and the tentacle actions are affected by the @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03multiactions00]{Multi-Action} penalty as usual.

Grappling rolls made with tentacles get a +2 bonus, and “crushing” causes the creature’s @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Strength} in damage unless otherwise listed.

Severing a tentacle is a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03calledshots000]{Called Shot}. If damage exceeds the creature’s @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01characters0000]{Toughness}, the limb is severed and the monster is @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03damageeffect00]{Shaken}. If it was already Shaken, it takes a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03damageeffect00]{Wound}.

Mist.name: Mist
Mist.description: • Mist: Ancient vampires have the ability to turn into mist. Doing so (or returning to human form) requires an action and a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Smarts} roll at −2.

Fast Regeneration.name: Fast Regeneration
Fast Regeneration.description: • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Special Ability (Regeneration)]{Fast Regeneration}: Some creatures heal quickly and may attempt a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03healing0000000]{natural healing} roll every round, even if @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Damage Effects]{Incapacitated,} unless their @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Damage Effects]{Wounds} were caused by ﬁre or ﬂame or they’re put to the torch afterward.

Gaseous Form.name: Gaseous Form
Gaseous Form.description: • Gaseous Form: Can maneuver through any non-solid surface, pass through cracks in doors or windows, bubble through water, etc.

Night Vision.name: Night Vision
Night Vision.description: • Night Vision: Sensor packages ignore penalties for @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03illumination00]{Illumination}.

Ornery.name: Ornery
Ornery.description: • Ornery: Mules are contrary creatures. Characters must subtract 1 from their @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Riding]{Riding} rolls when riding them.

Weakness.name: Weakness
Weakness.description: • Weakness (Invitation Only): Vampires cannot enter a private dwelling without being invited. They may enter public domains as they please.

Split.name: Split
Split.description: • Split: Some swarms split into two smaller swarms when @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Damage Effects]{Wounded} (GM’s call). Reduce the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Area Effect Attacks]{Blast Template} one size after a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Damage Effects]{Wound}; Small swarms are destroyed.

Children of the Night.name: Children of the Night
Children of the Night.description: • Children of the Night: Ancient vampires have the ability to summon and control wolves or rats. This requires an action and a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Smarts} roll at −2. If successful, [[1d6]] # Wolves summoned wolves or [[1d6]] # Swarms of rats summoned swarms of rats (see @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-bestiary.Swarm]{Swarm}) come from the surrounding wilds in [[1d6+2]] # Rounds until summoned rounds.
